sub_topic: Show that every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 × C2, or one of the 32 non-abelian groups of order 60.
message_1: How many non-abelian groups of order 60 are there and what are their names?
message_2:
There are 5 non-abelian groups of order 60. Their names are as follows:

1. A5 (Alternating group of degree 5)
2. S3 × Z10 (Direct product of the symmetric group of degree 3 and the cyclic group of order 10)
3. S5 ⋊ Z2 (Semidirect product of the symmetric group of degree 5 and the cyclic group of order 2)
4. D5 × Z6 (Direct product of the dihedral group of order 10 and the cyclic group of order 6)
5. D10 × Z3 (Direct product of the dihedral group of order 20 and the cyclic group of order 3)
